attributes.name: The Watchers on the Wall
attributes.next: "The Children"'''"The Watchers on the Wall"''' is the ninth episode of the Season 4

sections.Plot: The [[Night's Watch]], although hopelessly outnumbered, attempts to defend [[Castle Black]] from [[Mance Rayder]]'s massive [[Free Folk|wildling]] army, who plan to siege the fortress from the north. Meanwhile, a secret garrison of wildlings including [[Tormund]], [[Styr]] and [[Ygritte]] are poised to launch a surprise attack from the south of [[the Wall]].

'''"The Watchers on the Wall"''' is the ninth episode of the [[Season 4|fourth season]] of ''[[Game of Thrones]]''<ref>[http://www.spoilertv.co.uk/images/game-of-thrones/Season%204/Misc/Game+of+Thrones+-+Episode+4.08+-+4.10+-+Episode+Titles.png.php]</ref>. It is the thirty-ninth episode of the series overall. It premiered on June 8, 2014. It was written by producers [[David Benioff]] and [[D.B. Weiss]] and directed by [[Neil Marshall]].
sections.In the books:
: ''See:Â [[Differences between books and TV series - Season 4#The_Watchers_on_the_Wall]]''
* The episode is adapted from the following chapters ofÂ ''A Storm of Swords'':
** Chapter 55, Jon VII: The [[wildling]] scouts with whom [[Jon]] climbed the [[Wall]] attack [[Castle Black]] from the South. [[Styr]] is killed in the fight.Â [[Ygritte]] isÂ shot through the chest with an arrow, and she dies in Jon's arms.
** Chapter 64, Jon VIII: [[Mance Rayder]]'s army attacks from the [[Beyond the Wall|North]]. Jon is given command of the Wall, and he orders fire arrows and oil casks dropped on the [[giants]] and [[mammoths]]. All of the men who protected the gate tunnel die, including [[Grenn#In the books|their leader]], but not without first killing [[Mag the Mighty]].
** Chapter 73, Jon X: Jon goes North of the Wall to meet with Mance Rayder, with the mission to actually kill him.

====Cast notes====
*Only 5 of 26 starring cast members for the fourth season appear in this episode, the fewest ever in the history of the show.
*Starring cast members [[Alfie Allen]] ([[Theon Greyjoy]]), [[Gwendoline Christie]] ([[Brienne of Tarth]]), [[Emilia Clarke]] ([[Daenerys Targaryen]]), [[Nikolaj Coster-Waldau]] ([[Jaime Lannister]]), [[Liam Cunningham]] ([[Davos Seaworth]]), [[Charles Dance]] ([[Tywin Lannister]]), [[Stephen Dillane]] ([[Stannis Baratheon]]), [[Peter Dinklage]] ([[Tyrion Lannister]]), [[Natalie Dormer]] ([[Margaery Tyrell]]), [[Jerome Flynn]] ([[Bronn]]), [[Aidan Gillen]] ([[Petyr Baelish]]), [[Iain Glen]] ([[Jorah Mormont]]), [[Lena Headey]] ([[Cersei Lannister]]), [[Isaac Hempstead-Wright]] ([[Bran Stark]]), [[Conleth Hill]] ([[Varys]]), [[Sibel Kekilli]] ([[Shae]]), [[Rory McCann]] ([[Sandor Clegane]]), [[Iwan Rheon]] ([[Ramsay Bolton]]), [[Sophie Turner]] ([[Sansa Stark]]), [[Carice van Houten]] ([[Melisandre]]), and [[Maisie Williams]] ([[Arya Stark]]) are not credited and do not appear in this episode.
sections.Summary:
â€‹â€‹[[Jon Snow|Jon]] andÂ [[Samwell Tarly|Sam]]Â are standing watchÂ atop [[the Wall]], staring out into the darkness of the north and awaiting the imminent wilding invasion. Sam attempts to interrogate Jon about what it was like to be with a woman, stating that as their deaths are likely imminent, it may be his last chance to find out. Sam brings up that the vows of the Night's Watch onlyÂ explicitly forbidÂ members from taking wives or producing children, and that other "activities" are open to interpretation. Jon replies glumly that [[AlliserÂ Thorne]]Â most likely does not care about their interpretations. When further pressed by Sam to describe lying down withÂ Ygritte, Jon attempts to explain but is unable to properly express it, proclaiming exasperatedly that he's "not a bleeding poet."

Jon offers to take the watch up alone so Sam can go below, and as Sam steps into the elevator and begins to descend the Wall, an owl lands on top of the wall and begins hooting loudly. The owl is revealed to be controlled by aÂ [[Thenn Warg|Thenn warg]]Â who is a member of the garrison ofÂ wildlingsÂ under command ofÂ TormundÂ andÂ Styr, who haveÂ set up camp just outside of the southern entrance to Castle Black.Â TormundÂ boasts about a bear he supposedly had sex with, promptingÂ YgritteÂ to cut him short and cast her doubts on the validity of his claim. She tells him that she only cares about getting as many arrows through the hearts of "[[Night's Watch|crows]]" as possible. She angrily talks about how the people southÂ ofÂ [[the Wall]]Â shut the theÂ wildlingsÂ out by building it and hunting theÂ wildlingsÂ as enemies; she saysÂ that now theÂ wildlingsÂ are the hunters and the southerners the prey.Â StyrÂ mockingly replies thatÂ YgritteÂ has more words about killing than she has arrows. She defends herself by saying she killed just as many people at Mole's Town as he, butÂ StyrÂ replies that none of them was her former lover. He further mocks her by sayingÂ that when she sees him, she'll likely just serve him a slice of "gingerÂ minge", causing her to jump to her feet in anger.Â YgritteÂ staresÂ StyrÂ down, claiming that she wants to kill Jon Snow herself, then looks around the camp and warns the others that she has an arrow ready for anyone else who attempts to kill him. Just outside the camp, aÂ [[Gilly|shaded person]]Â cradlingÂ [[Sam|something]]Â passes by theÂ wildlings unnoticed.

â€‹Meanwhile,Â Sam is caught readingÂ a bookÂ aboutÂ wildlingsÂ byÂ Maester [[Aemon]].Â AemonÂ correctly guesses that Sam is reading the book because he wants to know what kind of fate might have befallen [[Gilly]] if she fell intoÂ wildlingÂ hands during the sack of [[Mole's Town]]. He also surmises that SamÂ has shown such a keen interest in her fate because he is in love with her, despite Sam's protests to the contrary.Â AemonÂ muses about the girl he once loved, stating that he can still picture her as clear as day and that she is more real than Sam is.Â After being dismissed byÂ Aemon, Sam leaves theÂ maester'sÂ chambers only to hear Gilly at the gate begging to be allowed inside, revealing her survival of the Mole's Town massacre and her identity as the cloaked figure approaching [[Castle Black]].Â [[Pypar]]Â attempts to deny her passage into the castle, saying he is not allowed to open the gate under any circumstances. However, Sam roars at PypÂ to allow her in, causingÂ PypÂ to relent andÂ let her in. Sam promises Gilly wherever she goes next he will go too, but their reunion is cut short by two blows from the horn, indicating thatÂ Mance'sÂ wildling army has finally begun their assault.Â Sam rushes to get Gilly safely inside the castle while other brothers of the Night's Watch prepare for the imminent attack byÂ wildlings.

On top of the Wall, Jon hears the horn blowing and looks north, witnessing a tremendous conflagration north of the Wall just asÂ ManceÂ had promised. He approachesÂ SerÂ [[AlliserÂ Thorne]], whoÂ finally relents and admits that they should have heeded Jon's advice and blocked the gates. He grimly muses that leadership means being second guessed by "clever littleÂ twatsÂ with a mouth" and when a man in charge second-guesses himself, all is doomed. Steeling himself for the impending siege,Â ThorneÂ begins barking orders to the archers, preparing them to fire upon the attackers massing below.

Sam bringsÂ Gillyâ€‹Â and her baby to a storage room where she can hide. Gilly wants Sam to stay with her as he promised, but he cannot as he swore to defend the Wall as a brother of the Night's Watch. Before he leaves her, Gilly begs Sam to promise her that he won't die and the twoÂ finally share a kiss. As Sam andÂ PyparÂ are preparing arrows at the southern gate,Â PyparÂ laments that he never seen a real battle before or ever even held an edged blade.Â PyparÂ asks how Sam is not afraid, but Sam replies that he is, as there are thousands ofÂ wildlingsÂ about to overrun them.Â PyparÂ asks how he managed to kill a White Walker while being afraid, and Sam says that at that moment, he just had to do something or Gilly would have been killed and her baby would have been taken. Sam further explains that at that moment, he wasn't himself; he was nothing, and when you are nothing there is nothing to be afraid of. Before walking away, he looks atÂ PyparÂ and says, "I'm not nothing anymore."

â€‹Meanwhile,Â YgritteÂ spies on the Castle to scout numbers of defenders. She tells the otherÂ wildlingsÂ that most of the guards are at the top of the Wall and that few are left in the Castle. The group prepares to attack, whileÂ YgritteÂ seems to have second thoughts. TheÂ ThennÂ warg suddenly snaps out of his trance and informs the group that the signal has been given, prompting theÂ wildlingsÂ to immediately take off towards Castle Black's southern gate. North of the Wall, the massiveÂ wildlingÂ army emerges from the woods, their numbers including giants riding atop mammoths.Â AlliserÂ orders the archers on the Wall to nock their arrows, but they draw instead whileÂ GrennÂ accidently drops a barrel down the Wall.Â AlliserÂ angrily drills his men on properly following orders when another horn blows from down below at Castle Black, signaling the unanticipated appearance ofÂ Tormund'sÂ band ofÂ wildlingsÂ at the castle's southern entrance. Realizing the dire need for experienced men to defend the keep from the surprise attack,Â AlliserÂ orders [[JanosÂ Slynt]] to assume command of the Wall's defenses and heads below to join the melee.

Below,Â TormundÂ andÂ Styr'sÂ forces charge the gate whileÂ YgritteÂ manages to pick off several men defending the gate with her bow.Â PyparÂ is firing a crossbow as Sam assists by reloading another crossbow, butÂ Pypar'sÂ aim is poor due to inexperience and nerves and he repeatedly misses his shots.Â The band ofÂ wildlingsÂ manage to reach Castle Black's walls and begin scaling them usingÂ grappling hooks and ropes, forcing Sam andÂ PypÂ to retreat.

AlliserÂ Thorne arrives with reinforcements from the top of the Wall via the wooden lift system, which is being operated by [[Olly]].Â AlliserÂ gives an impassioned speech, promising that the ancient order of the Night's Watch and Castle Black will survive this battle. His speech rallies the black brothers andÂ AlliserÂ personally leads the charge against theÂ wildlingsÂ who have breached Castle Black's defenses, causing an intense battle to erupt in the courtyard.

â€‹OnÂ the northern side of the Wall, aÂ wildlingÂ strike force led by two giantsÂ ([[Mag Mar Tun Doh Weg|one]]Â of which is riding a mammoth) charge towards Castle Black's outer gate. On top of the Wall, JanosÂ Slynt, having no true leadership experience, breaks down at the sight of the massiveÂ wildlingÂ army and begins fumbling his orders.Â GrennÂ steps in by falsely claiming thatÂ AlliserÂ needs Janos back down in Castle Black. Janos believes the lie and leaves, allowing Jon to take command of the Wall's defenses. The black brothers continue to rain down arrows on the advancingÂ wildlings, even killing ones that are attempting to scale the Wall.Â [[Giant (The Watchers on the Wall)|One giant]], armed with a massive bow, manages to fire a huge arrow at one of the bunkers atop the Wall, completely obliterating it and killing the black brother manning it.

Down in Castle Black, the battle rages on between the wildlings and the Night's Watch. Styr and Ygritte continue to slay numerous black brothers. At one point, a group of wildlings breach Castle Black's dining hall. One wildling is killed when a black brother throws boiling stew in his face and beats him to death with the pot. Hobb, Castle Black's cook, calmly enters the dining hall and kills a wildling with his massive butcher's knife. Meanwhile, Janos Slynt hides in the back of the kitchens, where he discovers Gilly and her baby.

Pypâ€‹Â manages to kill a wildling with his crossbow, but is then shot through the neck by Ygritte. Sam comforts Pyp and stays with him until he dies. Sam is forced to leave Pyp's body and as he heads to Castle Black's lift system, but he is spotted by the ThennÂ warg. The wargÂ charges at Sam as he desperately attempts to load his crossbow, managing to do so and firing a bolt into the warg's head just before he reaches him. Meanwhile,Â Alliser ThorneÂ is locked in a vicious duel with Tormund on the catwalks of Castle Black, both seemingly evenly matched in skill. However, Thorne suffers a grievous wound and is forced to retreat, being dragged to safety as he continues to shout orders to his men.

The black brothers defending the Wall manageÂ to repel most of the wildlingsÂ attacking the outer gate, but one giant manages to make it through, greatly weakening the gate by repeatedly smashing it with his fists and managing to singlehandedly begin lifting the gate. Jon, knowing the inner gate won't hold against the massive giant, sends a group of black brothers led by Grenn to hold it at any cost. Sam arrives atop the Wall to ask Jon for more men to defend the castle, and Jon tasks Sam with releasingÂ [[Ghost]] from his pen to assist in the fighting. Jon descends the Wall and finally enters the fray, quickly dispatching several wildlingsÂ and catching the attention of Styr; the two meetÂ in a single combat.Â Styr eventually gets the upper hand by knocking [[Longclaw]] away and brutally assaulting Jon, smashing his face into an anvil and tossing him into the blacksmith's forge. StyrÂ picks Jon up and begins strangling him, butÂ Jon spits blood in Styr's face and distracts him long enough for Jon to grab the blacksmith's hammer lying next to him and buriesÂ it in Styr's skull.

Upon killingÂ Styr, Jon turns around to findÂ Ygritte pointing her bow at him with an arrow drawn. He smiles at her, causingÂ Ygritte to hesitate. Before either can say anything, Ygritte is shot through the heart by an arrow fired from Olly, avenging the death of his father at Ygritte's hands during the wildling attack on his village. Jon holds her in his arms as she tells him that they should have never left the cave, and they lament circumstances that prevented them from being together as she succumbs to her wound.

Atop the Wall, [[Eddison Tollett]], who Jon left in command of the defenses, orders the men to drop the 'scythe'. A huge section of ice suddenly falls away from the wall revealing a massive scythe-like blade attached to a chain that swings along the Wall,Â cleaving through theÂ wildlingsÂ attempting to climb its face. Eddison notices the wildling forces are beginning to withdraw into theÂ [[Haunted Forest]], proclaiming that they have stopped them for now, but that the wildlings still outnumber the black brothers 1,000 to 1 and that Mance was simply testing their defenses. Below, a heavily woundedÂ Tormund is surrounded in the courtyard but continues to fight despite being the only wildling alive in Castle Black. He is finally subdued by Jon with a crossbow and taken prisoner by the Night's Watch for interrogation.Â Sam returns to Gilly just like he promised and discovers Janos Slynt, who hid in fear during the entire battle.Â Against all odds, the Night's Watch have repelledÂ ManceÂ Rayder's forces for the time being.

The following morning, what is left of Castle Black's garrison begin to regroup and prepare for the inevitable next attack by Mance Rayder. Jon discusses with Sam that he has a suicidal solution to end the wildlingÂ threat; he plans to assassinate Mance Rayder, noting that he is the only thing binding the disparate wildling clans that make up the army, and his death will rob them of that purpose and leadership. Sam tries to talk sense into Jon, but to no avail. As Jon prepares to leave via Castle Black's tunnel, they discover the bodies of the black brothers who held the inner gate against the giant. Grenn is amongst the casualties and Jon tells Sam that all bodies must be burned. Before Jon leaves, he remembers the promise he made to [[Jeor Mormont]] and decidesÂ to leave [[Longclaw]] with Sam. Sam tells Jon to come back, and Jon looks and Sam and smiles unreassuringly before stepping out into the wilderness on the other side of the gate.
